intro: Cryptantha argentinica, commonly known as the Argentine cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Cryptantha argentinica is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
